admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental impact
            assessment of the Second Gas Transmission Project for
            Thailand.  The project consists of supply and construction
            of a gas transmission system including related ancillary
            facilities.  The potential soil erosion and terrestrial
            ecology impact can be mitigated by a minimization of the
            clearing area and backfilling and replacement of groundcover
            after pipeline burial.  The marine water quality and the
            aquatic biology may be affected by sea bottom disturbance,
            waste disposal, chemical discharge from the hydrostatic
            test, and gas leakage from the pipeline.  These can be
            mitigated by the selection of spoil areas for trenching,
            placing gravel at spans, prohibition of waste dumping,
            provision of onboard waste receptacles, the use of proper
            hydrostatic test chemicals, and the installation of on-line
            gas leakage and pressure change detection systems.  The
            public health/safety impacts during construction come from
            possible health problems and accidents, living conditions in
            the construction camps, and possible gas leakage.  These are
            mitigated by the provision of proper health and
            environmental sanitation, adequate safety devices, and
            stringent regulations combined with comprehensive training
            programs.  The anticipated impacts are mostly short term and
            relatively minor.  Furthermore, the mitigation measures
            proposed will reduce the impacts to acceptable levels.
